subject: Re: [junit] Promlem in writing Test case
msgSnippet: ... Can you not have a couple of XML files [1] with known answers and check that reading those files gets you the answers you expect? [1] Which you might
messageBody:
On Tuesday 14 November 2006 07:07, avinash anand wrote:
> Hi All
> I am writing a test case in JUnit. The original class GetInfo.java has a method.
> String getSystemVersion(String str) which is under test. This method is supplied
> with path variable in form of string from where it reads a xml file to get certain
> data and return back to the user.
>
> The point of confussion for me is to how to test the method. What should be the actual
> and expected result. Meaning for getting the expected result I will have to use the
> same logic as it is in the main code, if I use the same logic to read the xml file
> then the assert statement would not be meaningful as then the expected and
> actual results would be same.

Can you not have a couple of XML files [1] with known answers and check
that reading those files gets you the answers you expect?

[1] Which you might construct in a scratch area, although you might
also consider having getSystemVersion also have a variant that
takes a stream content rather than a pathname.

--
Chris "hantwig efferko VOOM!" Dollin
The "good old days" used to be much better.
